alert.note: Alert for San Diego County Inland Valleys (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued February 22 at 9:50PM PST until February 23 at 10:00AM PST by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible late Friday into Saturday night. * WHERE...A portion of Southwest California, including the following areas, San Diego County Coastal Areas, San Diego County Mountains and San Diego County Valleys. * WHEN...From Friday afternoon through Saturday evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Low-water crossings may be flooded, including roads in Fashion Valley near the San Diego River. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - An incoming storm system and associated atmospheric river will bring widespread rainfall to the area later in the day Friday into Saturday. Heaviest rain is expected Saturday morning. Rain rates of 0.50 inches per hour expected.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
